sn12.27:2.10: Normally the path leads to the cessation of “suffering”. This shows another way of integrating dependent origination with the path.
sn12.27:3.1: The remaining items are presumably to be expanded per SN 12.2.
sn12.27:5.1: This confirms that one who knows the path and dependent origination is a stream-enterer.
sn12.27:5.2: The idiom āhacca tiṭṭhati is used for the river “pressing into” the ocean (MN 73:14.1), or the tongue “pressed against” the roof of the mouth (MN 100:17.2).
